page.title: 01LANDSCAPE AROUND COILACRIECH
page.content: 1. Farming Approximately one third of the area is taken up by farmland. The majority of this is used for sheep grazing and for hay and silage. The most fertile land is to be found on the floor of the valley of the River Dee, where grassland is intensively managed. However, in Glen Gairn, a tributary valley of the Dee the terrain is much more hilly and soils less fertile resulting in much less intensity of farming. Only about 10% of the farmland is used for crops such as barley and fodder rape.
